Portugal does better The study denotes that, despite the various exchanges between Brazilian and Chinese higher education, the truth is that “many more Chinese students return from exchanges in Portugal, whose best universities offer exchanges with Chinese students”, considering that “it will take a long time until that Brazil builds a teaching culture in China ”. Thus, “compared to Brazil, Portugal has a greater framing in the teaching of Portuguese abroad”, providing “Teaching Programs and Scholarships for Chinese Students”, Master's and PhD level, without forgetting “Partnership with the Camões Institute ”. “Portugal also facilitates the acquisition of titles, as well as promoting the translation of Portuguese novels in China. On the other hand, Brazil does not make such a structured effort. As a result, currently, most Chinese Portuguese-speaking students tend to use European Portuguese as a base or at least as a reference, ”he says. Thus, João Simões and Daniel Veras consider that “Brazil can capitalize on the current context, which encompasses several favorable factors, to adopt a more collaborative approach to the promotion of Portuguese language in China”. The study states that, currently, Portuguese is spoken by more than 264 million people on five continents, and it is expected to rise to nearly 400 million people by 2050, with “the African continent responsible for the largest increase”, reinforcing The preponderance of Portuguese as one of the most spoken languages ​​in the southern hemisphere. In addition, Portuguese is an official or work language in 32 international organizations. With the arrival of Lula da Silva to the presidency of Brazil for the second time, the authors consider that he “has tried an approach to China”, namely in the commitment to join the initiative “a track, a route” and the appointment “of a representative permanent at the Macao Forum ”. The academics cite another author's idea regarding the existence of “distrust and reserve that Brazil has shown over the years in relation to the Macao Forum”. Greater involvement “can help to guarantee China access to vital resources and markets in Brazil and Africa, potentially contributing to China's food and internal energy security” as well as enhancing Macau as a “cultural channel between China and the World Lusophone ”. However, “although there is political will and a favorable environment in Macao, more concerted efforts will be needed by Brazil to materialize these opportunities,” is mentioned.

item.title: Chinese New Year | Tourism and trips boosted consumption
item.description:
The period of Chinese New Year's holidays has come to an end, official numbers do not lie: China has crossed an intense consumer period, especially related to travel and tourism. Between January 28 and this Tuesday, some destinations in the country broke records of visitors
It is at the beginning of each year that the economy awaits the one who is one of the high moments for tourism and consumption in China. The Chinese New Year represents not only a moment of family life, but also the opportunity for many Chinese to travel. This year, to celebrate the year of the serpent, millions of people traveled internally and also out of the country between January 28 and Tuesday, and according to Xinhua the numbers are impressive with regard to purchases or number of visitors in some Destinations. The Altay City Hall, in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region, is referred to as one of the great ski destinations in the country, having received between January 28 and 31 191,900 visitors, a tourist flow that generated 225 million Yuan in revenues. The agency points out that "skiing has definitely became the most popular activity in Altay during the holidays," leading to "a record number of practitioners, more than 10,000, to visit Jiangjunshan's ski resort on February 2". This represented "an increase of 23 percent over the previous year." The Altay zone is famous for registering between 170 and 180 days of snow per year, and in the mountainous areas the average snow depth reaches between one and two meters. Another region of China that reached considerable numbers on the Chinese New Year holidays was Yangshuo County in the Autonomous Guangxi Zhuang region, thanks "to unique natural landscapes and rich cultural activities." Between January 28 and 30, this area received about 410,600 tourists, generating tourist revenues of 589 million Yuan. In turn, Lhasa (in Tibet) also registered an increase in the number of visitors. Between January 28 and Monday, the city received 1.95 million tourists, representing an increase of 20.6 percent over the previous year, and found in tourist revenues almost 1.76 billion Yuan. This is an increase of 14.75 percent compared to the previous year, according to the Lhasa Municipal Culture and Tourism Office. Positive data from agencies Also according to Xinhua, the Chinese New Year's numbers also revealed themselves on travel reserve platforms. In the case of Fliggy, one of the main online agencies, "an increase in reserves, especially for cities such as Shanghai, Beijing and Guangzhou" was recorded. On the other hand, "international travel orders have increased significantly, with international cruise reserves increasing more than six times compared to the previous year." Regarding air traffic, Shanghai Airport Group reported that passenger traffic on Sunday has reached a new historic record of 404,000 people, with Pudong Airport in Shanghai, to record 259,000 passengers and Hongqiao Airport 145,000 passengers. There was also a “reinforced coordination of the services of metro, buses and taxis to ensure transport without problems” with the arrival of the end of the holidays, said the group. On Monday, China State Railway Group Co., Ltd. recorded “a historic milestone” as they were transported on all railways a total of 16.45 million people. This is the “largest passenger traffic in a single day in the history of the Spring Festival Race”. Only this Tuesday, the last day of the holidays, will have traveled 16.9 million passengers, a number that highlights “even more the peak of travel, since hundreds of millions of people returned to their destinations after family meetings” . Comes and Babies As far as tourism is concerned, it was found “a growing number of people who sought to know the heritage of China, motivated by the registration of the Spring Festival in the representative list of UNESCO's Immaterial Cultural Heritage, in December 2024”, indicates the state agency. Data from the Ministry of Commerce show that sales in major retail and restoration companies throughout China, during the first four days of holidays, increased 5.4 percent compared to the same period last year. There was an increase in consumption of imported food and drinks, such as lobsters, beer and wine. "Due to increased demand during the Spring Festival, our company's imports increased almost 50 percent last month," said Yang Xinyu, who represents a company in the Guangzhou -based international supply chain. Since January that the customs authorities of Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport have enlarged the importation of food and crab products, 31.8 percent compared to 2024, translated the total of 14.3 million Yuan. Many online shopping And if the Chinese New Year is synonymous with family reunion, the holidays were once again a time for online shopping. Meituan, one of the country's leading electronic service platforms, has recorded an “impressive increase” of 300 percent over the previous year in online reserves for Lunar New Year's Eve dinners. It should be noted that “group orders for packages with the theme 'intangible cultural heritage' have increased more than 12 times since January, year after year, reflecting the growing interest of consumers in cultural experiences.” Sun Jiashan, an associate researcher at the Central Academy of Culture and Tourism Administration, said, according to Xinhua, a change in consumer behavior, especially by young people and families. "Young families are increasingly becoming the driving force of consumption, with a tendency for diverse, high quality and culturally rich experiences," he said. Meituan Travel data corroborates the analyst's observation that young people increasingly choose to celebrate the Spring Festival in smaller cities, plunging into intangible cultural heritage and historical landmarks. The increase in tourism and cultural consumption, from equity experiences to successful films, indicate a growing demand for traditional and contemporary cultural activities. "This trend has also led to increased demand for cultural and tourist products and services, giving rise to the introduction of new models and business formats that adapt better to contemporary cultural consumption standards," Sun said, highlighting the potential of the Chinese consumer market and the internal driving forces of the economy. But not only shopping was made this Chinese New Year, as "the country's film industry proved to be one of the biggest winners during the spring festival's consumer wave." Between January 29 and February 3, the ticket daily revenues exceeded billion yuan for six consecutive days, raising the ticket offices of this year's Spring Festival to 8.02 billion yuans, According to China's movie administration data, China's total box office on this year's holidays, including real-time pre-sale, exceeded ten billion Yuan.

item.title: BIR | Approved 13 requests submitted by Portuguese in 2024
item.description:
Last year, both requests for residence submitted by Portuguese and the approval rate fell to the lowest values ​​since 2019. In 2023, the government changed the law, to prevent the Portuguese from having preferential access to the status of residence by exercise of Specialized technical functions
Last year, the authorities received 20 requests for residence from Portuguese citizens and approved 13, an approval rate of 65 percent. The data were advanced on Tuesday by Macau channel, which cites data provided by the Public Security Police (CPSP). In 2024 the first full year was lived since the Government of the MSAR extinguished the preferential access regime to the residence by Portuguese who performed specialized technical functions. The change arose following new guidance on migration services, issued in August 2023, after the amendments to the law of residence proposed by the government and approved by the Legislative Assembly. Therefore, the approved reasons had to be based on the family gathering or the existence of connections prior to Macao. While 13 requests were approved, on the other, seven requests were refused, representing a rejection rate of 35 percent. However, according to the data presented by the broadcaster, the number of Portuguese with access to residence status reached historically low values, including when the comparison is made with the pandemic period, when the borders were closed, or had strong restrictions of Circulation as the imposition of quarantines that have been greater than 25 days. Almost always falling According to the figures presented by the Macau channel, in 2019, the pre-pound year, among the 116 requests submitted, 112 were approved, in which was a 96 percent approval rate. By 2020, the first year of the pandemic, 66 requests were approved. For this number they counted not only the 56 requests made throughout this year, but also processes that had been left by the previous year's process. Nevertheless, in view of the requests submitted to the station indicates that the approval rate was 100 percent. In the year 2021, in the middle of the pandemic, the number of orders dropped to 20, the same number as the year it recently over. However, 17 requirements were approved, which meant an approval rate of 85 percent. Regarding 2022, 32 requests for residence were submitted by Portuguese, which resulted in 31 approvals, an approval rate of 96 percent. Finally, in 2023, the first year of reopening and when the end of the preferred residence regime for Portuguese citizens came into force, 56 requests were made, with the approval rate to be 92 percent.

item.title: Residence for the elderly | New applications until tomorrow
item.description:

item.title: Post Office | Announced Retoma of Service for the USA
item.description:
Macao Post Office resumed sending small packages and orders to the United States, but warned that new suspensions cannot be excluded due to US postal service policies
The Post Office of Macao and Hong Kong announced yesterday the resumption of sending small packages and orders to the United States after five days of suspension. In a statement, the Post Office of Macao (CTT) announced that they will accept again, from February 11, “all mail objects (…) for the United States”. In the same message as the Macao Post and Telecommunications Directorate Directorate, CTT recalled that the suspension "may have originated a correspondence, which will possibly result in delays in the delivery of shipments to the US." "Additionally, the possibility of any changes in the policies of US postal services [USPS) cannot be excluded at any time," the company warned. The Macao Post Office message was preceded by one of Hong Kong's counterpart, in which they said they had been “formally notified” by the US Postal Service that US authorities “currently do not impose additional fees on postal articles. with commodity ”. On January 5, the company said it had been notified by USPS that it could only send packages or orders that customers had registered with customs and the protection of US borders (CBP). The registration would require “the necessary import documents and the payment of fees made through a customs dispatcher,” added the Hong Kong Post Office. After the suspension of shipping, the company “continued to negotiate” with USPS and “can temporarily resume” the postal service for the United States. Temporary suspensions On February 4, USPS announced that it would temporarily stop accepting orders from China and Hong Kong (without any reference to Macao) “until new order”. But hours later, USPS reversed the decision without justifying, just stating that it was going to work with the CBP to implement a collection process for the new rates imposed on Chinese goods in order to avoid interruptions in delivery. The new US President Donald Trump increased customs rates on China's imports at 10 percent after retreating in the plans to charge Canada and Mexico. The vast majority of goods sent from China arrive outside the mail system, but Trump's order specifically eliminated a tariff exemption for low -value products, purchased directly by consumers and sent through postal service. This exemption covered articles of less than US $ 800. The USPS measurement could block or delay orders made through Chinese e -commerce platforms Shein and Temu.

item.title: Macao in the year of the serpent and mass tourism
item.description: (Continuation of the February 6 edition) The area from Senate Largo to Rua de S. Domingos, Rua da Palha, Travessa do Bispo and Travessa da Sé should be thoroughly planned in tourist and gastronomic terms and the stores should be located there for Chinese cuisine, Macaense, Portuguese and International and the remaining spaces are explored by stores of tourist interest and recommended by Macao tourism services. Only in this way Macau will honor the distinction of being considered a creative city in the area of ​​gastronomy by UNESCO and will produce in part the longed for economic diversification. Other types of urban planning to tourist activity and gastronomic scripts should also be created in other areas of Macau, Taipa and Coloane. Mass tourism alters the social landscape of any destination. In Macao, the influx of millions of tourists every year has transformed local customs and traditions. The local population, which is significantly smaller than the annual number of tourists, sees their cultural practices and lifestyle overshadowed by the growing marketing of the region. The balance between the preservation of cultural identity and the satisfaction of mass tourism is complex. Macao's previous head of the Macao Executive, Ho Iat Seng, advocated initiatives that promote cultural tourism, with the aim of showing the rich heritage of Macao from its modern attractions. These efforts include heritage conservation projects and local handicraft promotion, allowing residents to interact with tourists in an authentic and respectful way. On the other hand, local feeling can be a challenge, as some residents express frustration with the overwhelming presence of tourists. The growing population of tourists creates agglomeration in public spaces and facilities, leading to the dissatisfaction of the local inhabitants. The resolution of these tensions is essential to maintain a harmonious coexistence between residents and visitors. The environmental impact of mass tourism is another critical aspect that deserves to be discussed. Macau's rapid urbanization led to remarkable ecological changes. The construction of resorts and casinos resulted in the loss of habitats and increased pollution. The increase in the number of daily tourists contributes to waste production (where rats are proliferating and also invading stores in the historic center including those serving food) and the use of local resources, which arouses concerns of sustainability. Recent efforts started by the Macao government focus on the attenuation of these negative effects through environmental regulations and ecological initiatives. In order to promote sustainable tourism practices, proposals include the incentive to use public transport (insufficient and where users are fitted by dealership employees in Ferreira do Amaral Square and drivers as if it was shouting and where those Large bags of tourists take the place of users and hurt them sometimes without anyone prohibiting such practice) and the promotion of ecological construction initiatives for new enterprises. These policies reflect a growing awareness of the need to preserve the Macao environment of its economic ambitions. Several influential personalities shaped Macau's tourist landscape. Among them is the late Dr. Stanley Ho, one of the most prominent figures of the casino industry and one of the main architects of Macau transformation into a global game center. His vision and investments had a lasting impact on the region, leading to the construction of several milestones that are now synonymous with Macao Tourism. In addition, public and private sectors leaders are crucial in promoting responsible tourism practices that residents require. Hospitality and tourism management professionals should defend sustainable strategies to balance economic growth and environmental conservation. Their efforts should contribute to the ongoing discussions on the maintenance of a viable tourism model in the face of changes in market dynamics. The prospects for mass tourism in Macau vary widely among stakeholders. Government officials often emphasize economic benefits, seeing tourism as a vital engine for growth. They promote policies that attract investments and tour operators, arguing that these measures create job opportunities and improve infrastructure. On the other hand, local residents may have a more critical perception of tourism. They emphasize the negative effects on their quality of life, including cultural dilution and increased cost of living. Its voices illustrate the need for a more inclusive approach to tourism development that gives priority to community participation and feedback. From a business point of view, tourism sector operators are caught between tourists and local community's needs. Although they strive to attract visitors, they also have to consider the long -term sustainability of their operations. If local feeling continues to sour, it may end up endangering your business. Looking to the future, Macau faces various developmental challenges. The COVID-19 pandemic had a dramatic impact on global tourism, including in Macao, where the number of visitors has fallen significantly since the early 2020. Recovery strategies should now align with sustainable development goals. The government is exploring diversification beyond play and mass tourism, promoting cultural tourism, sports events and family attractions as alternative pathways. With the resumption of trips, Macao has the opportunity to reconcellize his tourism model. The adoption of ecotourism and cultural initiatives can help attract more visitors. Innovative marketing strategies that enhance unique cultural heritage and Macao's natural beauty can increase its attraction and at the same time mitigate the negative aspects of mass tourism. The sectoral collaboration between government bodies, local communities and the private sector will be crucial to shaping a future tourist landscape that benefits all stakeholders. The involvement of local populations in tourism planning and decision making can create a sense of shared property, ultimately leading to a sustainable and inclusive tourist framework. The relationship between Macao's cultural evolution and the mass tourism phenomenon reveals a multifaceted and complex dynamic. The year of the serpent serves as a reflection of growth and transformation in this context. Although mass tourism has generated significant economic benefits, it also has challenges related to social, environmental and cultural consequences. To ensure a balanced approach, stakeholders must work in collaboration to navigate the intricacies of tourism development, ensuring that Macau maintains their unique identity, while benefiting economically. As the tourist landscape evolves, the adoption of sustainable practices and the promotion of community involvement will be fundamental to preserving the essence of Macau for future generations.

item.title: Australia interdicts social networks to children under 16 (II)
item.description:
Last week, we mentioned that the Australian Parliament approved the amendment to the “Internet Security Law (minimum age for access to social networks) on November 28, 2024, interdicting access from under 16 to most networks. The content of the law is simple, but from the point of view of its operation, there are several issues that deserve to be debated. First of all, Australia is not the first country to legislate this matter. In Europe, many countries have already restricted children's access to social networks. The established minimum age varies from country to country, but usually between 13 and 17 years old. Secondly, in Florida, the United States, the restriction of access from children under 13 to social networks triggered a process by limiting freedom of expression. The same may happen in Australia after the implementation of the new law and this will be a risk that the Australian government will have to run. Third, when one identifies a minor that transgresses the law, only the company that manages the social network is punished. The minor and parents are not considered responsible. In this sense, the law fails as a disciplinary. This approach can lead to conflicts around the assignment of liability when it comes into force. Some question whether this means to blame for social networks, ignoring the pedagogical responsibilities of families. There may be two reasons why the new law does not criminally responsible for infrastructors. First, as social networks are very popular, people generally use them, and those under 16 are easily influenced. Second, laws may predict different minimum ages for infrastructors to assume criminal liability. In Australia, the age of criminal liability is between 10 and 14 years, which means that certain transgressors aged between 10 and 14 may assume a certain degree of criminal responsibility. The new law increases the age of criminality in two years, apparently to allow users under 16 to avoid being held responsible and to prevent more children from breaking the law due to their tender age. But, on the other hand, if we only punish social networking companies that provide the tools for children to violate the law, the responsibility will only fall into these companies? Isn't this a way to put the car ahead of the oxen? In Australia, there is a new law in force to which social networking companies have to obey. However, in countries where there is no restrictions on the use of social networks by children, personal technology companies may consider establishing some restrictions to deny minors access to these networks. For example, Tiktok, Facebook and Snapchat have stipulated the minimum age of 13 years for their users. The restrictions imposed by these companies can benefit their image and reduce criticism from children's access permission to networks. Industry self-regulation is an effective way to reduce the impact of social networks on children. Fourthly, the new law requires social networking companies to take measures to verify the age of users. There are currently three viable methods of age verification: biometric analysis, online activities verification and identity document verification. Biometric analysis implies that users send a photo to the platform for the software to determine their age. It is not known if the photo will be eliminated after the age determination process is completed. Online activity verification requires users to provide their email account and, from there, an analysis will be based on the accounts related to the account. Verification of identity documents is another possibility of determining the age of users. It is unlikely to be accurately evaluated whether a user is over 16 years old based on photos or based on his online activity. However, the new law clearly stipulates that users cannot carry identity documents on social networking platforms, which will make it difficult to determine their age. If the three age determination methods have problems, it is questionable that the new law can be implemented without startles. No wonder the goal, the mother company of Alphabet's Google, Facebook and Instagram, has declared in a presentation in the Australian parliament that expects the new law to be postponed until the age test will be completed. A goal spokesman said Facebook respects Australian law, but is concerned about the process in which they have rushed to pass legislation to ensure an age of access to social networks, but ignoring the opinions of others. Next week we continue our analysis.

A magistrate of excellence, from professional virtuosity to all the introvert evidence, has never taken any less dignified attitude towards his subordinates and even severely condemned an admittedly homosexual individual who had sexually abused a minor. At that time it was a scandal if it came to know that the judge was homosexual and would certainly be expelled from the judiciary. One day he confessed to me that he had a single and secret companion almost his age. I pretended that I did not give importance to the outburst and always had the ease of obtaining important information about legal proceedings that the judge was kind to provide me as a journalist. My comrades were surprised how I had such credible court sources and even asked the origin. Obviously they never got any response on my part. This comes by justice that in Portugal we have judges and judges of very high degree of competence, seriousness and independence. Absolutely incorruptible. And we have others who simply fulfill their mission with the aim of obtaining the greatest possible peculio. They are corrupt, they are maneuvered by the Lobis of Powerful Lawyers' offices and, unfortunately, if they are homosexuals take positions of a deplorable degree. They reach the point of warning the defendant suspected of domestic violence or sexual abuse of minors in order to know how much possible amounts can pay if they are acquitted at the time of trial. These facts have happened over decades. Before and after the military coup of April 25, 1974. Recently, we were all aware of the shameful attitude of Judge Rangel who was to the point of handing over to an internship lawyer the writing of the judgments that were distributed to him. These judgments, which rangel or neither read or only provided the intern the indications that he was in. As it would have to happen, Rangel was expelled from the judiciary. Justice in Portugal has always been led by absurd corporatism, where no sovereignty organ had the power to intervene in structural change. Justice in Portugal these days,-not to mention the past where a trainee judge was left to obtain his promotion was seen by a clerk to have oral sex to a senior judge in his office-it is manifestly a justice for very rich citizens. No poor man has any chance of paying a lawyer so that his defense is worthy and fair. Of course we know the existence of unofficial defenders, who most often are little interested in the processes concerned, but justice that there are exceptions. We, from our own experience, had an exceptional unofficial defender, of a peculiar competence that dedicated themselves to the process as if they were receiving a lot of money. Last week, the country was aware of a scandal related to a judge accused of paying poor minors for sex. A jubilant magistrate from the Azores paid 25 euros to minors each time he had sex. There is no memory that a magistrate was accused and investigated by the court of a crime allegedly of such seriousness. A man reported that the judge attracted minors for sex with ice cream and pizza and that the judge resorted to the prostitution of minors paying to have oral sex after approaching the minors on the street and who lived in precarious conditions. The judge will be tried for resorting to minor prostitutes. The conclusions of a case of this gravity can lead the Portuguese to think what would have been this judge's career. Would there have been maneuvered sentences in exchange for homosexual sex? Had the magistrate received amounts of money when they appeared in the bar of the defendants accused of violation of minors? Will the magistrate misrepresented judgments that accused sexual violators of minors? Everything can be considered in the face of ignoble behavior that came to public by a jubilated judge. We are waiting for the best Portuguese magazine that addresses all social and judicial problems, “Justice with A”, directed by a great prestigious judge, will address this theme in a next edition. It turns out that the theme that involves incompetent, corrupt and now pedophiles cannot be unpunished and should be the target of the biggest debate on the part of society. Jubilated Judge Manuel Mota Botelho is now being tried for 16 crimes of resorting to the prostitution of minors. The crimes will have occurred between 2019 and 2023 in São Miguel, in the Azores. The Jubilee Judge is renovated but ended his career as Judge Counselor of the Court of Auditors, and this institution decided to call the Permanent Commission to analyze the situation of the Azorean Councilor accused of abusing six minors over four years. The Permanent Commission has the responsibility to establish disciplinary proceedings and apply sanctions. It has long been asking for a structural reform of justice in the political sphere and nothing has been done. Corporatism remains a reality and the country is fed up with processing processes that take more than a decade to be completed, especially when it comes to "important" citizens. item.title: Venice | Architecture Biennial wants to propose inclusive solutions for climate urgency
item.description: Venice's Architecture Biennial curator Carlo Ratti defended the urgent need to move from the mitigation phase to adapt climate change and growing world population through multidisciplinary and inclusive solutions. The architect spoke at a joint press conference with the president of the Venice Biennial, Pietrangelo Buttafoco, to present the event that will feature 66 national appearances in the historic pavilions of the gardens, Arsenal and in the center of Venice. In this edition, which will take place between May 10-Awards and Advertisement Day-and November 23, four countries will debut: Azerbaijan, Oman, Qatar and Togo. “How will the climate be in a hundred years? How will the population evolve? ”, It was the issues launched by the curator in their intervention, stressing that the direction of these two factors“ will be crucial to the future of architecture ”. "Intelligins". Natural. Artificial. Collective ”was the theme chosen for the event, which every two years concentrates proposals of contemporary architecture from around the world, and will feature the project“ Paradise today. ”, Curators Paula Melânea, Pedro Bandeira and Luca Martinucci, and of the assistant curators Catarina Raposo and Nuno Cera in the official representation of Portugal. Recalling that architecture has always been a response to the hostile environment for human survival needs, Carlo Ratti said the climate has become less and less tolerant, giving Los Angeles fires as an example in the United States, floods In Valencia, in Spain, and the droughts of Sicily in Italy. “For decades, architecture's response to climate crisis has focused on mitigation-on conception to reduce our impact on climate. But this approach is no longer enough. The time has come for architecture to embrace the adaptation: rethink the way we project to an altered world, ”said the curator.

item.title: Shanghai | Warner Bros signs agreement to open Harry Potter theme park
item.description: Chinese Entertainment and Tourism company Jinjiang International announced yesterday signed a contract with American studio Warner Bros, to open a park with the Harry Potter theme in the city of Shanghai. According to the Chinese company, the project is still pending the approval of the authorities and its opening is scheduled for 2027. The goal is to renew Jinjiang Park, the first Shanghai amusement park, inaugurated in 1984 and, since the beginning of the 21st century, has the first China's first ferris wheel, over 100 meters high. Its operator announced its temporary closure in late January for renewal works. The so-called “Harry Potter Studio Tour” will extend by an area of ​​about 53,000 square meters with interior and covered areas, and an estimated mid-day visit time. In its various areas, visitors will be able to travel the scenarios of the saga, interact with the props used in the movies and see behind the scenes images to understand how the novels were brought to the great screen. With the reconstruction of the enclosure, which has a subway stop to the entrance that allows the city center to connect in less than half an hour, Jinjiang International intends to “make it an emblematic project that will attract fans [from the Harry Potter saga] at all the country and even from all over the world. ” Shanghai opened in 2016 the first Disneyland park in mainland China - in 2005 opened in the Hong Kong semi -autonomous territory - and from this year's summer will also have the first Lego thematic complex in the country.

item.title: Photography | Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro Images Exposed in Lisbon
item.description:
It will be inaugurated next week, Thursday, the exhibition “Poetics Urban-Wanging for the Daily Macao”, by Portuguese photojournalist Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro, who will be evident in the Malangatana Gallery of ISPA-University Institute. This exhibition is born from the book of the photojournalist that has lived in Macau for over 14 years
Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro will exhibit his work in Lisbon from next week, Thursday 20. This is the show “Urban Poetics-Wanging on Macao's daily life”, which will be evident at the Malangatana Gallery, ISPA-University Institute. According to a statement, the show comes following the launch of its latest namesake book, presented in December last year in Macao. Based in the region for over 14 years, the photographer has been highlighted by the sensitive and poetic record of urban life, capturing fragments of the daily life that evoke universal memories and emotions. In the preface to the work, US photojournalist Andrea Star Reese describes Pinheiro as “a visual poet” whose lens transports us to stories that echo within us. “Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro is a man unconditionally in love with the streets he runs and the people he discover. All photojournalists tell stories, but some photograph with a lyrical grace. Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro is a visual poet. ” Andrea Star Reese also describes that in this exhibition, as in the book, the photojournalist leads us “to a place that keeps pieces of lives that remind us of ourselves, others we have seen or know, feelings we have, we had, want to have or we forget. ” Speaking to the newspaper Público, when the book's launch, Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro described the content of the book, based on images of the old neighborhoods and a territory that has been in permanent change in recent years. "The changes are visible in the rhythm of the city, in the dynamics between tourists and residents, but there are also in an internal layer of people." In the faces of those who live in Macao, he also mentioned, there are signs of introspection, "an attempt to find meaning in times of uncertainty." “When seen from another angle, the seemingly banal moments [I captured] can reveal the poetry I like so much; These moments reflect humanity and arouse reflection, ”he said. Long career Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro was born in Lisbon, more precisely in the alfama neighborhood, precisely where the ISPA is located. In Macau he was a journalist, editor of HM and has kept his career as a photojournalist who began in the sports press in Portugal. Currently collaborates with Lusa agency. Winner of several awards throughout his long career, Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro also held several exhibitions, in his own name and collectively. In 2015 he published his first book entitled “Macau 5.0 • 澳門 5.0 • Macao 5.0”. In 2019, he presented "Myanmar: the portrait of a people." In 2021, it presents two books: “Improper • 關愛 • Zeal”, edited in Macau, and “Tonle Sap”, released in Brazil. “What was not…”, published in 2022, was so far his most successful book, having reached the second edition. In 2023, he edits a collector box with the 20 -year retrospective with the title “a glimpse of light • 一瞥光亮 •“ The Glimpse of Light ”. This year, he also published “Near Me • 離我很近 • Close to Me”, an intimate and unusual edition. It is represented in Brazil by Icon Artes Galeria and, in Macao, by the Gallery Amagao. His photograph is part of the contemporary collection of MA-G-The Museum of Avant-Garde that will open doors in Switzerland in 2025.

item.title: Galaxy Arena | Jason Zhang brings Macao tour in March
item.description:
Chinese singer Jason Zhang (Zhang Jie) will be in Macao in March for three shows at the Galaxy Arena, integrated into the “Future Live - Leave for 1982” tour. This is the opportunity to listen to a singer who has built a career around pop music since 2014 and recently recorded “Adrenaline” alongside James Blunt
“Future Live - Leave for 1982” is the name of the tour that Chinese singer Jason Zhang (Zhang Jie) has led to several stages and which in March brings to Macau three concerts, between the 7th and 9th. At Galaxy Arena from 19:30, and tickets have been on sale since Tuesday. The shows promise to offer the audience and fans the best pop songs of the singer who started in the musical lines in 2004. It will be, according to Galaxy, a kind of “journey through time, a train on the way from 1982, a moment when The past meets the future. ” 1982 is, by the way, the date of birth of the artist, born in Chengdu, and which by the end of 2023 already had a total of 15 recorded albums and 87 concerts. The beginning of a happy career happened in 2004, when he won the “My Show” contest. This participation earned him a contract with Universal Music producer in China and, from there, Zhang Jie no longer stopped making music and winning his audience. In this early phase of his career, Zhang Jie released in 2005 the first album, entitled “The First Album”, having won the “Global Chinese Music Chart Most Male Newcomer” award, as the name implies, to new artists. The second album arrived the following year, with the name "Love Me Again", consecrating themselves as a pop artist with a repertoire of romantic ballads. His career has also been based on some partnerships with musicians and Western Boys Band, highlighting the concert he gave at the Boao Forum in 2010 in which he sang two songs by star Michael Jackson, “Billie Jean” and “Beat It ”. Moreover, in 2012, Jason Zhang was invited to sing the song “My Love” in a Westlife concert. "Adrenaline" with James Blunt Jason Zhang's latest collaboration with a foreign artist is “Adrenaline”, a single of 2021 recorded with James Blunt, who became known for the successes “You're Beautiful” and “Goodbye My Lover”. At the time of the release of "Adrenaline", Jason Zhang stated on social networks that "it was an honor to record the new song" Adrenaline "with James Blunt," "a good song I hope to be heard by more fans." Last year Jason Zhang started with the tour in China, "Future Live: To 1982", with 17 shows in five cities, including some concerts in international stops. Now follows a new tour with passing through Macau. Jason Zhang is one of the best known singers in the country, having, in 2020, entered the 86 position of the Forbes China Celebrity 100, ie the ranking of the 100 largest Chinese celebrities. The artist's latest album was released in 2023 and calls himself “Wainan Street 1982”.

item.title: Airport | Flights from and to Japan and South Korea will increase
item.description: CAM - Macao International Airport Society announced yesterday that it will increase the frequency of routes to Japan and South Korea throughout the current year. In addition, a new connection between Macao and the Korean city of Cheongju will be created in April, which will have a frequency of two weekly flights, the director of Cam's marketing department, Eric Fong, said yesterday. The representative indicated that negotiations are underway to open airlines to “Southeast Asia Islands”, not to mention destinations beyond the Vietnamese island of Phu Quoc. On the table is also the possibility of launching an aerial route to the capital of Laos, Ventiane. Eric Fong also mentioned that Cam is betting on launching offers to encourage airlines to increase international flights to Macau. As for long -haul calls, Eric Fong wants to attract and encourage airlines to launch transfer flights to Europe, America and Middle East, revealing that Cam is communicating with Middle East air carriers. Another of the objectives is to strengthen cooperation with travel agencies and charter companies to offer long -haul flights. In addition, the official recalled that last year EM established 31 shuttle bus stations in Guangzhou, Foshan, Jiangmen, Zhaoqing, Dongguan, Zhuhai to bring passengers to Macau airport through Gongbei and Hengqin.

item.title: Single Account | Interface “My Health 2.0” was released yesterday
item.description: Health services launched yesterday the update “My Health 2.0”, available in the Macao Single Account. The new version of the “Operation Interface” was designed to be more intuitive, “Health Management” services were optimized for better adaptation and “medical record” was expanded for greater scope, health services indicated yesterday. The new version, whose launch was initially planned until the end of last year, was presented by the head of the Department of Health Services Information Technologies, Leong Kei Hong, at the first plenary meeting of the Commission for the Healthy City after its restructuring. One of the commission's missions, which was presided over by the new secretary for social affairs and culture, LAM, is to reach communities, through cooperation between public services and collaboration with different sectors and associations, to develop synergies and allocate resources in the community. The objective is to promote healthy behaviors and active health management, to raise the quality of life and self -management capacity of residents. During the meeting, the LAM stressed that in the future, "it will firmly implement the spirit of central government instructions, committing to the realization of the four main objectives presented by the 6th Government of MSAR."

item.title: BNU | Net profits of more than 585 million in 2024
item.description:
The National Overseas Bank had net profits of 585.1 million patacas last year, a result that represented a small break of 0.4 percent compared to 2023. The net income fell 4.2 percent, a break offs off by the rise. Commissions and liquid fees
The National Bank Overseas (BNU) announced yesterday net profits of 585.1 million patacas last year. Compared to the previous year, there was a slight drop of 0.4 percent of profits, read in a statement released yesterday by the bank. In 2024, it refers to the note, the net income of interest registered a drop of 43 million patacas, less 4.2 percent compared to 2023, “mainly to changes in the composition of deposits and the context of interest rates in force ”. "This decrease was partially offset by an increase of 9.2 million patacas (+11.3 percent) in liquid commissions and rates, underlining the recovery of economic activity," is added. In addition, the results of financial operations grew 13.4 million patacas, or another 30.7 percent, in homologous terms, “mainly due to the absence of losses with the sale of obligations recorded in 2023”. Also according to the data released, operating expenses decreased 0.2 percent, in annual terms, “demonstrating the effectiveness of cost optimization measures”. The simplification of operational processes and the strategic review of the service portfolio "compensated for high investments in digital transformation initiatives, talent development programs and brand visibility campaigns." Solid state Last year, BNU's total capital ratio “reinforced it to 24.4 percent”, plus 1.9 percentage points compared to 2023, “with robust liquidity reserves that confirm the solidity of the bank balance”, reflecting Disciplined financial management, solid risk mitigation practices and the ability to navigate complex economic conditions. ” It is added that "the quality of BNU assets remains robust, with the bank prioritizing prudent risk management and maintaining proper provisions coverage for potential macroeconomic uncertainties." In the statement that announces the results of 2024, the BNU reiterates the “fundamental role” of the Hengqin branch in support for Macau and Hong Kong investors, including individuals and companies, in a context of deepening the integration of the great bay and the cooperation zone Deepened between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin.

item.title: Elevators | About 2,000 devices still inspected
item.description: A little over a month from the deadline for the annual elevators inspection, the Macao Professional Engineering Association estimates that it is still missing about 2,000 elevators. The numbers were advanced yesterday by Tam In Wo, vice president of the Association, in statements to the newspaper or Mun. According to the association's head, there are currently 10,500 lifts recorded in the territory. According to the Legal Security Legal Regime, Elevators of the Territory must be inspected once a year. In the newspaper or Mun, the vice president of the association has left the desire for elevators' owners to make the inspection until April 1, date. The official also pointed out the attitude of the owners as the main obstacle to the inspection, considering that they do not want to pay for the possible replacement of worn parts or due to the costs of installation and inspection. However, the vice president of the Macao Professional Engineering Association warned that if accidents occur in elevators who were inspected the insurers may refuse to take responsibility. Tam In Wo also pointed out that if the elevators are not inspected, they should be suspended by the owners.

item.title: Hengqin | Three companies with registration through Macau
item.description:
Among the approximately 90 processes dealt with through the service provided by IPIM, three were able to register in the in-depth cooperation zone, which means a success rate of 3.3 percent
Since November 2021, three companies have been able to register in Hengqin through the transfronical commercial registration service in the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau. The data were made available to HM, by the Institute for the Promotion of Commerce and Investment (IPIM), responsible for the service in conjunction with the Directorate of Commercial Affairs Services of the Deepened Cooperation Zone. According to IPIM information, since November 2021, when the service was launched, "more than 100 commercial registration requests were fulfilled, of which nearly 90 orders were completed." The HM asked the body the data on the outcome in terms of registrations successfully completed, refusal of registration and dropouts that departed from the candidates. The IPIM's response did not present the data clearly, and it was only indicated that since 2021, there were “three Portuguese investors” who “had license to explore activities in the deepened cooperation zone, whose areas are dedicated to the legal consultancy, in management of projects, among others ”. If it is taken into account that 90 cases were completed and these three companies were registered in the deepened cooperation zone, then the refusal rate of registration by interior or withdrawal authorities around 96.7 percent. In contrast, the success rate is 3.3 percent. Excluding the first two months of service operation and accounting for only the period between 2021 and 2024, an average was approved a registration application per year under the transfronical commercial registration service in the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau. Pending processes Although HM did not have questions about the matter, IPIM indicated that among companies registration requests, "about 7 percent are Macao with foreign capital from Portugal, Germany, Czech Republic and Australia." Information about the remaining 83 percent was not indicated, which may mean that it came from companies with only Chinese capitals. In a statement issued last week, the IPIM had indicated that among the 90 requests processed about 40 percent are linked to integrated tourism and leisure industries, health, finance, cutting -edge technologies, convention and exhibitions, commerce, culture and sport, the areas in which the government bets to diversify the economy, in the scope of policy 1+4. Regarding the approximately 10 pending registration processes among the 100 with which this service has had to deal with since its inception, IPIM explained that “they are in follow -up, or need to deliver complementary documents or are in adjustment by the companies requesting ”. The Transfronho Commercial Registration Service in the deepened cooperation zone allows Macao companies to treat commercial registration procedures in Macau and obtain business licenses without the need to move to Hengqin, which is viewed as a way to reduce time and economic costs of investors wishing to invest in the in -depth cooperation zone.

item.title: Carbon Monoxide | Hospitalized elderly due to intoxication
item.description: Health services revealed yesterday that a 79 -year -old man had to receive medical treatment at the Conde de São Januário hospital emergency service after passing out due to carbon monoxide poisoning. The case happened on Sunday afternoon in the Vai Long building (Block I), in the Alameda da Tranquility, when the resident was taking a shower in a bathroom where a gas water heater is installed. The resident “began to feel sudden dizziness and eventually fell inanimate on the floor of the bathroom”, where he was found by family members, who immediately called an ambulance. At Conde de São Januário Hospital did laboratory tests, which revealed concentrations of carbon monoxide hemoglobin. The elderly was “undergoing hyperbaric oxygen therapy treatment” and is currently considered stable. Authorities add that the gas water heater has been installed in the bathroom for over a decade, and that despite the installation of a ventilation, the bathroom has no windows. At the time of the occurrence, the exhaust was not connected and the authorities suspect that the incident was caused by the lack of maintenance of the device and the accumulation of residual gas in a poor ventilation environment.

item.title: Game | JP Morgan indicates improvements in search
item.description:
Despite the most positive trend, JP Morgan admits that compared to February last year there may even be a reduction in gross reciters
After the Lunar New Year, the search for the game in the Macau casinos is "better than the feared." The conclusions are part of the latest report by the JP Morgan Securities (Asia Pacific) investment bank on the territory, which does not fail to moderate growth expectations about the main industry in the territory. "The game's gross recipes stabilized after the Lunar New Year," wrote DS Kim, Mufan Shi and Selina Li analysts in a report quoted by the GGR Asia portal. However, not everything is good news for the local economy, and analysts now indicate that gross game recipes “may only grow at one digit level, between one percent and four percent throughout this year, compared to the period homologist ”. Compared to February, analysts expect gross revenues to be between 18.3 billion patacas and the 19.4 billion patacas. These values ​​mean that compared to last year, in the worst scenario, revenues may have a break from one percent, and that in the best scenario can grow up to five percent. “The gross revenues of the new Lunar post-year game have become better than expected, reaching 725 million patacas a day, thanks to a solid demand at the end of the year, which is in a way offsetting weakness [of the revenues] of the Lunar New Year ”, was justified. On the other hand, JP Morgan indicates that the weakness of revenues is more related to previous industry expectations, than actually to the amount generated by the territory tables, which between February 1 and 5 were 900 million PATACAS per day . The report indicates that in the first nine months of the year the revenues were 7.4 billion patacas. Low review The scenario outlined by JP Morgan Post-Anno New Lunar, contrasts with the one that was lived during the festivities and which led another investment bank, Citigroup, to reduce predictions about the expansion of the Macao game this year. In a report published on Monday, Citigroup analysts, George Choi and Timothy Chau, presented a scenario where the game's gross recipes record a growth of 3 percent, which contrasts with the previous optimism, when it was expected that the sector expansion reached 7 percent. And in the first half of the year, the investment bank admits that gross revenues even record a reduction of about one percent.
